Package com.eventApp.DAO

Class EventDAO

java.lang.Object
com.eventApp.DAO.EventDAO
public class EventDAO extends Object
Data Access Object for event-related database operations. Handles CRUD operations for events, event filtering, and event management workflows.

  • Constructor Details

    • EventDAO

      public EventDAO()

  • Method Details

    • createEvent

      public void createEvent(Event event) throws SQLException, ClassNotFoundException, ValidationException
      Creates a new event in the database for a specific club.
      Parameters:
      event - the Event object containing all event details to be inserted
      Throws:
      SQLException - if database operation fails
      ClassNotFoundException - if database driver is not found
      ValidationException - if event creation fails at database level

    • getEventList

      public List<Event> getEventList(String approvalStatus, String completionStatus)
      Retrieves events filtered by both approval status and completion status. Used to fetch events that match specific workflow states.
      Parameters:
      approvalStatus - the approval status to filter by (e.g., "approved", "pending")
      completionStatus - the completion status to filter by (e.g., "completed", "not completed")
      Returns:
      List containing all events matching both status criteria

    • getEventList

      public MyEventLL getEventList()
      Retrieves all events from the database, regardless of approval or completion status.
      Returns:
      MyEventLL - a linked list of all Event objects from the database

    • getEventList

      public MyEventLL getEventList(String statusOfEvent)
      Retrieves all events with a specific approval status (e.g., "approved", "pending").
      Parameters:
      statusOfEvent - the approval status to filter events by
      Returns:
      MyEventLL - a linked list of Event objects with the given approval status

    • approvalStatusUpdate

      public boolean approvalStatusUpdate(String approvalStatus, int eventId)
      Updates the approval status of a specific event in the database.
      Parameters:
      approvalStatus - the new approval status to set (e.g., "approved", "rejected")
      eventId - the ID of the event to update
      Returns:
      true if the update was successful, false otherwise

    • getEventNames

      public List<String> getEventNames(String userId)
      Retrieves names of events associated with clubs where the user is a member. Uses JOIN query to find events through club membership relationship.
      Parameters:
      userId - the ID of the user whose club events to retrieve
      Returns:
      List containing event names accessible to the user

    • getEventIdBy

      public int getEventIdBy(String eventName)
      Retrieves the event ID for a given event name. Assumes event names are unique in the system.
      Parameters:
      eventName - the name of the event to search for
      Returns:
      int event ID, or -1 if event not found

    • getMyEventList

      public List<Event> getMyEventList(String userId)
      Retrieves events that a user has registered for and are not yet completed. Uses JOIN with event_registration table to find user's registered events. Returns minimal event information needed for user participation view.
      Parameters:
      userId - the ID of the user whose registered events to retrieve
      Returns:
      List containing simplified Event objects for registered events

    • getEventListByClubId

      public CircularLL getEventListByClubId(int clubId) throws SQLException, ClassNotFoundException, DatabaseExceptionHandler
      Retrieves all events for a specific club using a circular linked list data structure. Used for club-specific event management and display.
      Parameters:
      clubId - the unique identifier of the club
      Returns:
      CircularLL containing all Event objects for the specified club
      Throws:
      SQLException - if database operation fails
      ClassNotFoundException - if database driver is not found
      DatabaseExceptionHandler - if data retrieval fails

    • cancelEvent

      public void cancelEvent(int eventId) throws SQLException, ClassNotFoundException, DatabaseExceptionHandler
      Cancels an event by updating its completion status to "Cancel". This is a soft delete operation - the event record remains in the database.
      Parameters:
      eventId - the unique identifier of the event to cancel
      Throws:
      SQLException - if database operation fails
      ClassNotFoundException - if database driver is not found
      DatabaseExceptionHandler - if the cancellation operation fails

    • updateEvent

      public void updateEvent(Event currentEvent) throws SQLException, ClassNotFoundException, DatabaseExceptionHandler
      Updates all modifiable fields of an existing event. Performs a comprehensive update of event details while preserving the event ID.
      Parameters:
      currentEvent - the Event object containing updated information
      Throws:
      SQLException - if database operation fails
      ClassNotFoundException - if database driver is not found
      DatabaseExceptionHandler - if the update operation fails
